item.title: Updates - May 12, 2019
item.description: Fermentation - Sauerkraut Cat and I made a few batches of Sauerkraut over the last few weeks. It was super easy and delicious. We used a combination of the recipes found in Real Food Fermentation: Preserving Whole Fresh Food with Live Cultures in Your Home Kitchen by Alex Lewan and The Noma Guide to Fermentation, with help on some of the physical, technical tasks from Brad Leone’s videos. One issue we ran into with the batch above was that we over-seasoned.

item.title: Our Growing Space
item.description: Want to give a quick introduction to the growing space that we are working with. My partner Cat and I rent an apartment in Somerville, Massachusetts. We live with two cats and grow most of our plants in our spare room that we only let the cats in if we are around (because they love munching on the plants). Our spare room has a small south-facing window that directly faces another building.

item.title: Furb-Sust
item.description: In August 2018 I embarked on a project focused on developing skills for refurbishing items and improving my personal sustainability practices to reduce my and my community’s wastefulness. I designed this activity around ideas in Jane Mcgonigal’s Superbetter.
